definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China

sentences.english: I had to look over to see if she was reading from a cue card.
sentences.chinese: 這使得我必須仔細檢查她是否在閱讀大字報。

sentences.english: The angry man ripped off the big character post on the wall.
sentences.chinese: 這個憤怒的男人撕掉了貼在牆上的大字報。

definition: to drag sb before a public meeting to denounce, humiliate and physically abuse them (esp. during the Cultural Revolution)
to sensationalize (idiom); deliberate exaggeration to scare people
to obscure the facts (idiom); to mislead the public with prevarication and deliberate falsehoods
to kill sb for his property (idiom); to murder for money
to fly into a rage out of humiliation/to be ashamed into anger (idiom)
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
to condemn in speech and in writing (idiom)/to denounce by word and pen
